title: See how Jared Leto and Mark Ruffalo fooled fans at New York's Comic-Con
text:
See how Jared Leto and Mark Ruffalo fooled fans at New York's Comic-Con See how Jared Leto and Mark Ruffalo fooled fans at New York's Comic-Con 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Jared Leto and Mark Ruffalo had fans completely fooled when they donned disguises to hang out at New York’s Comic-Con. 
Jared – who plays The Joker in DC’s Suicide Squad – and Mark, aka The Hulk in Marvel’s Avengers movies, wore elaborate masks to hide their identities and enjoy the convention in the Big Apple. Mark Ruffalo unmasked (Richard Shotwell/Invision) 
And the comic book crowd will be kicking themselves that they didn’t spot their heroes. 
Jared later posted a photo on his Instagram page revealing his Rafiki from The Lion King mask. 
He even posed with one fan dressed as his villainous alter-ego, who was completely oblivious that he was in the presence of greatness. 
— JARED LETO (@JaredLeto) October 11, 2015 
Fellow actor Mark took his children to the event, and also wore a mask to avoid being mobbed. 
He posted photos of his disguise on Instagram, writing alongside the image: “Got to hide out and enjoy #comiccon2015.” Share article 
Marvel fans couldn’t believe they had missed him, with one commenting: “What!!! Hulk was there!!!” Promoted Stories
